#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=I loved Queen , Deep Purple , Pink Floyd , A-ha , Beatles ,
#Text=Police , Cher and many others .
#Text=I still love them .
#Text=( ( Mike Halterman ) ) You were trained in classical piano at the Music Conservatory in Lviv . How did the skills you learned while studying there impact your musical style now ?
#Text=Ruslana : When I graduated from the conservatory , I obtained two educational qualifications in the field of music as a piano player and a symphonic orchestra conductor .
#Text=My music education helps me very much to create my own music .

#Text=For example , [ a ] few years ago at Lviv 's 750th anniversary , I performed " Energy Source " as conductor of a symphonic orchestra that played my own composed music in a beautiful light show .

column1: #Text=( ( Mike Halterman ) ) I interviewed Edsilia Rombley last month and she has a situation similar to yours , in that the main collaborator and producer of her music became her husband as well . How did you meet your husband and what led you to form a musical partnership ? Also , how did the two of you fall in love ?
#Text=Ruslana : Both of us were born in Lviv .
#Text=We had the same friends , the same interest , objectives and the same love – music .
#Text=I wanted to work with professionals and Sasha was [ a ] famous singer [ at ] that time in Lviv .
#Text=He had his own band .
#Text=So we met about work .
#Text=From the first second I understood that we have [ a ] kindred spirit .
#Text=Music connects us .
#Text=And with our first song appeared our first feelings ...

#Text=( ( Mike Halterman ) ) When you first started receiving recognition and becoming successful in the Ukraine in the mid-1990s , was it overwhelming ? What was your main motivation in your career during this time ? Was there ever a time where you considered leaving the music industry to live a quieter life ?
#Text=Ruslana : No , I was born for music .
#Text=I love what I 'm doing with all of my heart .
#Text=The first thing [ about ] recognition [ is that ] I should be very truthful with myself and with people .
#Text=It 's very important .
#Text=I 'm always honest with my fans .
#Text=If you work only for money and you sing a song that you must sing but you do n't feel it all of your heart and soul – you will be [ a ] singer for [ only ] one day .
#Text=Wild Dances
#Text=File : Ruslana at concert 1 . jpg

#Text=Ruslana performing her song " Wild Dances , " in which she incorporates the musical styles of the Hutsul ethnic minority from the Carpathian Mountains in western Ukraine . ( Image missing from commons : image ; log )

#Text=( ( Mike Halterman ) ) In more than one project , including your Wild Dances CD , you have worked extensively in the unique musical tradition of the Hutsul people . What caused you to pursue such a niche ? Also , are there any important things about the Hutsul people and tradition that people may not know , that you wish you could bring awareness to ?
